newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Aug 29.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Aug 29.

text.p: * Baxter International Inc said it would acquire Immuno International AG over three years in a deal worth about $715 million. The companies had combined sales of $1.6 billion in 1995. Baxter shares closed at 42-7/8 on Wednesday.

* Novell Inc said Robert Frankenberg resigned as chairman, president and chief executive. The company said it named John Young chairman and Joseph Marengi president. Novell also said it started a search for a new chief executive. Novell closed at 11.

* Summit Bancorp said it would acquire B.M.J. Financial in a stock swap valued at $164.5 million. Summit said it will exchange 0.56 Summit share for each B.M.J. share. Summit closed at 38-7/8 and B.M.J. closed at 14.
* U.S. Diagnostic Labs Inc said it ended talks to acquire Alliance Imaging Inc. U.S. Diagnostic closed at 9-7/8 and Alliance closed at 5-1/4.
* Foamex International Inc said it sold its JPS Automotive unit to a Collins & Aikman Corp unit for $220 million. Foamex closed at 16-3/8 and Collins & Aikman closed at 6-5/8.
* Housecall Medical Resources Inc said it expects to report a fourth quarter loss, with revenues and net income falling short of expectations. Housecall closed at 14-1/2.

* Curtis Mathes Holding Corp said its fiscal 1996 loss narrowed to $0.35 per share from $0.45 in the prior year. The company also said it expects a $1.2 million debt-related gain in the fiscal 1997 first quarter. Custis Mathes closed at 1-25/32.
